channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Pakistan in ‘open war’ against Afghanistan: Which military is more powerful?
No ‘bhangra’ for Carney? Why Canada PM won’t visit Punjab, unlike his predecessors
What a post-‘El Mencho’ power struggle could mean for Mexico
Body-fat test for candidates. Is Deepinder Goyal’s hiring call for his start-up, Temple, insensitive?
'She's at the bottom of the pool': How Indian-origin doctor's call adds to mystery of daughter's death
From judiciary to Mughal history: When NCERT textbooks wrote the ‘wrong’ chapter
Why El Mencho’s death won't end Mexico’s cartel crisis
item.description: Removing one or two kingpins does little to dismantle the structural embedding of organised crime in Mexico. The cartels are woven into local governance, significant portions of the legal economy and the social fabric in many regions

item.title: How Canadian PM Carney’s India visit marks a quiet but pivotal reset
item.description: Mark Carney’s vision centres on 'variable geometry' alliances, recognising India as a rising global power that Canada must engage across trade, technology and defence

item.title: When PM Modi said ‘Am Yisrael Chai’: A civilisational moment in India-Israel ties
item.description: India and Israel find themselves in a geopolitical state where each could immensely benefit the other. But the relationship is becoming more than merely about geopolitics

item.title: Dealing with China: How India is developing deterrence infrastructure in Northeast
item.description: Rapid mobilisation, air power superiority, and uninterrupted logistics convert the eastern theatre from a vulnerability into a zone of credible deterrence

item.title: Why the AI Impact Summit matters geopolitically
item.description: The Delhi summit underscored the growing linkage between AI governance, strategic rivalry and Global South aspirations

item.title: How the end of panda diplomacy signals the deepening rift in China-Japan ties
item.description: The departure of Japan’s last giant pandas marks more than the end of a diplomatic tradition; it reflects the deepening chill in China-Japan relations
